New Records: David Warner and Mitch Marsh hit a record-breaking 259-run opening stand, the highest ever in a World Cup match for Australia
Key Match Events: Marcus Stoinis took two wickets to deliver the momentum shift for Australia
Adam Zampa claimed 4-53 to set off a late collapse and end any hope of a Pakistan fightback
Pre-Game Insights: There were no specific pre-game insights mentioned in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Captain Pat Cummins praised David Warner and Mitch Marsh's efforts, saying 'That was proper from those two. It set the tone, it's how we want to play our cricket. To take 80-odd in the powerplay was impressive, we can't ask for anything more than that.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win lifts Australia into the top four finals-paying spots for the first time, back on level pegging with a 2-2 record
David Warner was forced to downplay a groin niggle after failing to take to the field following his 163 from 124 balls
Adam Zampa battled both illness and back soreness to claim 4-53
Others: The article does not provide any other significant mentions beyond the match performance
